|buttons = |led = |dimensions = |weight = |wi1_if_name = |rad1chip1 = Broadcom;BCM4360;BCM4360KMLG; |rad1oui = |rad1_ant_conn = RP-SMA |rad1txchains = 3 |rad1rxchains = 3 |rad1sstreams = 3 |rad1stand = IEEE 802.11b/g/n |nqam1 = 600 |rad1n = 450 |rad1g = 54 |rad1b = 11 |rad1freq = 2.4 |rad1correv = 40 |rad1cap = }}{{TIDTOC|embedded}} ==Overview== "ASUS RT-N18U REV 2.20" is silkscreened on the board in the FCC photos. {{see also|ASUS RT-N18UHP|ASUS RT-N800HP}} Per ''ASUS'''s product page, this device has 128MB Flash and 256MB RAM. *This device is using [[Broadcom]] BCM4360KMLG (3T3R) - :QAM-256 (nqam) modes will be available for use. :RAM: 256MB (DDR3-1600), Flash: 128MB NAND (SLC) :1x USB 3.0, 1x USB 2.0, 3x 2dbi antenna ==Links of Interest== ===Reviews=== *[http://www.foxnetwork.ru/index.php/en/component/content/article/168-asus-rt-n18u.html Review on '''FoxNetwork'''] *[http://www.techbang.com/posts/18041-updated-version-of-rt-n16-using-the-dual-core-processor-asus-rt-n18u Review on '''TechBang'''] *[http://www.ixbt.com/comm/asus-rt-n18u.shtml Review on '''iXBT'''] (RU) *[https://openitforum.pl/index/recenzje/routery/asus/rt-n18u/ Review on '''OpenITforum'''] (PL) ===Forum threads=== {{Dead link|http://tomatousb.ru|On '''TomatoUSB''' forums}} (RU) ==Flashing== {{Flashnotice}} ===Flashing dd-wrt=== Supported by dd-wrt as of = rt-n18u build 24118 20140523 Please insert instructions here ===Flashing OpenWrt=== {{OpenWrtNotice|broadcomwifi}} {{OpenWrt |techdata = https://openwrt.org/toh/hwdata/asus/asus_rt-n18u_a1 |wikipage = https://openwrt.org/toh/asus/rt-n18u |forumpage = https://forum.openwrt.org/viewtopic.php?id=53417 |forumpage2 = |forumpage3 = |github = |target = bcm53xx |subtarget = generic |arch = arm_cortex-a9 |support_started_version = 15.05 |current_supported_version = 23.05.0 |unsupportedfuncntions = [https://openwrt.org/unsupported/wifi_2.4ghz_partly WiFi 2.4GHz partly] |image_too_big = |unsupportedfuncntions = |comment = }} Please insert instructions here ===Flashing Tomato=== Please insert instructions here ==Notes== ===Probable included PSU(s)=== The power supply shown in the FCC photos is a :'''Leader Electronics''' MU18-R120150-A1. {{hasPowerSupply |brand = Leader Electronics |model = MU18-R120150 |revision = -A1 |input_v=100-240 |input_a=0.6 |input_c=AC |input_hz=50/60 |input_conn=NEMA 1-15P |output_v=12 |output_a=1.5 |output_c=DC |output_conn=barrel |countrymanuf = China |e_level=5 |style=medium, horiz. }} ===GPL info=== {{SCollapse|GPL info â€¢ >> |
export RT-N18U := IPV6SUPP=y HTTPS=y ARM=y BCM57=y NTFS="paragon" HFS="paragon" 
 AUTODICT=y BBEXTRAS=y USBEXTRAS=y EBTABLES=y MDNS=y MEDIASRV=y MODEM=y GRO=y 
 BECEEM=y PARENTAL2=y ACCEL_PPTPD=y PRINTER=y WEBDAV=y CLOUDSYNC=y STAINFO=y
 DROPBOXCLIENT=y FTPCLIENT=y SAMBACLIENT=y XHCI=y APP="installed" MODEMPIN=y
 BUILD_NAME="RT-N18U" PROXYSTA=y DNSMQ=y SHP=y NVRAM_64K=y BCMWL6=y BCMWL6A=y 
 TUNEK="n" BCM5301X=y DISK_MONITOR=y LANWAN_LED=y OPTIMIZE_XBOX=y ODMPID=y  
 DUALWAN=y REPEATER=y ARMCPUSMP=up USER_LOW_RSSI=y OPENVPN=y TIMEMACHINE=y  
 VPNC=y BRCM_NAND_JFFS2=y JFFS2LOG=y XHCIMODE=y DEBUGFS=y SWEBDAVCLIENT=y
 BCM5301X_TRAFFIC_MONITOR=n DUMP_OOPS_MSG=y LINUX_MTD="64" BCM_RECVFILE=y 
 REBOOT_SCHEDULE=y MULTICASTIPTV=y USB="USB" SAMBA3=y QUAGGA=y
}} ==See also== *[http://www.asus.com/event/2014/network/ASUS_N_family_chart/solution.html ''Asus Wireless-N networking solutions''] [[Category:English Documentation]]
